12:43.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: 0-8 for Charlie Fellowes; 21,000gns purchase; merits a market check from an easing mark.
runners.name: Sword Of Wessex
runners.spotlight: Ex Charlie Fellowes; runner-up at Ffos Las (1m4f, novice) in August but disappointed at Yarmouth (1m6f; last of five) subsequently; joined this trainer for 21,000gns; merits a market check now back in trip from an easing mark.

runners.comment: Redcar winner (1m6f) in November; latest effort (2m) less convincing; others more likely.
runners.name: Haveyoumissedme
runners.spotlight: Sprung a surprise at Redcar (1m6f, good; 28-1) in November before running to a similar level here (12.5f; fourth) the following month; latest effort (2m) less convincing and this is the shortest trip he has tackled for some time; others more likely.

runners.comment: Fair mark; enough to prove on basis of two modest C&D efforts either side of Pontefract.
runners.name: Lightening Company
runners.owner: Middleham Park Cxv Barclay & Lycett Rcg
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles at Cartmel (2m1f, soft) last summer and finished runner-up on the Flat at Pontefract (1m2f, soft) in October; fair mark, but still enough to prove on basis of two modest C&D efforts either side; focus elsewhere.

runners.comment: Narrow winner of a Kempton novice (1m; 7-2) last February; Southwell is excusable; player.
runners.name: Selenic
runners.owner: Sir F Brooke & Sir R Pilkington
runners.spotlight: Sea The Moon filly; narrow winner of a Kempton novice (1m; 7-2) last February; hampered when making headway on belated return at Southwell (1m3f; handicap debut; 15-8 favourite) a fortnight ago; low mileage and well worth another chance.

runners.comment: Okay on first run for this trainer at Haydock (1m2f) in September; hasn't kicked on since.
runners.name: Imperial Trooper
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 12 came in a four-runner Ffos Las novice (7.5f, heavy); fared okay on first start for this trainer at Haydock (1m2f; third, 80-1) in September but hasn't kicked on since; returns from a three-month break with AW prowess far from conclusive.

runners.comment: C&D previous with King Chaos; Southwell runner-up latest; likely to play a positive role.
runners.name: Golspie
runners.spotlight: Got the better of King Chaos over C&D last month but meets that rival on 3lb worse terms (7lb higher) for three-quarters of a length; bumped into an in-form winner when runner-up at Southwell latest; no reason why he shouldn't play a positive role.

runners.comment: Weakened after taking a keen hold over C&D (125-1) 54 days ago; mark continues to ease.
runners.name: Cavalry Call
runners.spotlight: Won twice for the Crisfords, including on Polytrack at Chelmsford (1m2f; first-time visor) last April; yet to threaten since joining this trainer (0-5); weakened after taking a keen hold over C&D (125-1) 54 days ago; mark continues to ease.

runners.comment: C&D winner (from 7lb lower) in November; only fourth to Golspie and King Chaos latest.
runners.name: Prince Achille
runners.spotlight: In fine fettle over C&D during November, winning (from 7lb lower) before going down by the minimum margin next time; only fourth to today's rivals Golspie (winner) and King Chaos (second) latest, so needs to bounce back if he's to reverse those placings.

runners.comment: Beaten a neck over C&D in October; off since; now 4lb higher minus cheekpieces; possible.
runners.name: Jack Sparowe
runners.spotlight: Winless since September 2023; eased in the weights and rediscovered a spark in newly fitted cheekpieces at Kempton (1m4f; runner-up) in October before occupying that same position over C&D (beaten a neck) latest; 4lb higher off a 98-day break, minus headgear; possible.

runners.comment: 1-13; runner-up over a mile here (80-1) late last month; stamina questions over this trip.
runners.name: Maui Breeze
runners.spotlight: Won once in ten (a 6f AW maiden) for Charlie Fellowes; mixed form since joining this trainer, her best effort when runner-up to the thriving Second Fiddle over a mile here (80-1) late last month; stamina questions over this trip.

runners.comment: Things slotted neatly into place for a cosy 12.5f win here (from 3lb lower) 11 days ago.
runners.name: King Chaos
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Golspie over C&D and then did well (fourth) from a poor track position at Southwell, before things slotted neatly into place for a cosy 12.5f win here (7-4 favourite; from 3lb lower) 11 days ago; given a decent gallop to aim at, should be there or thereabouts.

13:13.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Classified Stakes

runners.breeder: Manister House N Anderton & P Leonard
runners.comment: Respectable showings, behind in-form rivals, over a range of trips recently; place claims.
runners.name: Catherine Chroi
runners.spotlight: No AW win since March 2024; respectable showings, behind in-form rivals, over a range of trips (6f-1m) recently, without doing enough to suggest that she's primed to strike; drop back to 7f is helpful and she might have place possibilities; one of two for Iain Jardine.

runners.comment: 12-race maiden; some headway from rear when fifth at Wolverhampton (7f; 25-1) penultimate.
runners.name: Chriss Mate
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden; some headway from the rear when fifth at Wolverhampton (7f; 25-1) on penultimate start but took a backward step over 6f here five weeks ago; others preferred.

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate (1-37); keeping-on fourth at Southwell (1m) on Saturday; more required.
runners.name: Dash Power
runners.spotlight: Poor strike-rate (1-37); runner-up at Wolverhampton (8.5f) before two more modest efforts; bit better in this grade when a keeping-on fourth at Southwell (1m; 17-2) on Saturday; more required.

runners.comment: 2-20; won at odds of 66-1 here (6f, Class 6) in November; underwhelming since (0-3).
runners.name: Green Valentine
runners.spotlight: 2-20 and increasingly difficult to predict; said to have benefitted from cover in a strongly run race when winning at odds of 66-1 here (6f, Class 6) in November; underwhelming in three subsequent starts; now tackles an extra furlong.

runners.comment: Won back-to-back C&D Class 6 handicaps in September but he's gradually lost his way since.
runners.name: Ring Of Gold
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back C&D Class 6 handicaps in September but he's gradually lost his way since, slowly away in each of his last two starts, including when last of nine at Southwell (1m; 7-1) a fortnight ago.

runners.comment: Maiden (0-16); often placed for S. Woods; weakened (last of nine) at Southwell (6f) latest
runners.name: Rock Master
runners.spotlight: Maiden (0-16); often placed for Sean Woods but yet to threaten to click into gear for this trainer; weakened late on when last of nine at Southwell (6f; 9-1) 16 days ago.

runners.comment: Encouraging third to in-form pair over C&D (beaten under 2l) 11 days ago; probable player.
runners.name: Rory
runners.spotlight: 7-91 but without a win since July 2024; didn't get the breaks when fifth at Southwell (6f) on penultimate start and was an encouraging third to an in-form pair over C&D (beaten under 2l) 11 days ago; a likely player under Mulrennan.

runners.comment: Yet to win on AW (0-25); finished last of seven over 6f here ten days ago; obvious risks.
runners.name: Shesashambles
runners.spotlight: Yet to win on AW (0-25); far from convincing since finishing fourth to Bishop's Glory over 6f here (7-1) in November; last of seven over 6f here ten days ago; clear and obvious risks.

runners.comment: Latest effort is excusable (1m2f); last win came at Chelmsford (7f) ten months ago.
runners.name: Sir Maxi
runners.spotlight: Last two wins came in amateur contests, including when justifying favouritism at Chelmsford (7f) last March; latest effort is excusable (1m2f) but, while his earlier C&D fourth (to Aisling Oscar) would give him a shout, it's hard to be confident.

runners.comment: Beaten a nose by Athollblair Boy over 6f here (7-2) ten days ago; clear & obvious chance.
runners.name: Superior Council
runners.spotlight: Holding his form remarkably well for the level, striking a fine rapport with this 7lb claimer Cara Tuke; beaten a nose by the evergreen Athollblair Boy over 6f here (7-2) ten days ago; clear chance from a form and weights perspective despite having an extra furlong to tackle.

runners.comment: Non-Runner
runners.name: The Gay Blade
runners.spotlight: Non-Runner

runners.comment: Non-Runner
runners.name: Wee Nan
runners.spotlight: Non-Runner

13:43.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2026 Not 2006 Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Creditable third over 6f here (50-1) on New Year's Day; now drops back to minimum trip.
runners.name: Mr Dreamseller
runners.spotlight: Took a step forward from his opening effort when a creditable third over 6f here (50-1) on New Year's Day; dropping back to 5f - dam was a half-sister to Modular Magic - could assist; still appears to be a work in progress.

runners.comment: Beaten a neck on last month's C&D debut; likely to improve from that initial experience.
runners.name: Dandy Breeze
runners.spotlight: £38,000 yearling; pushed the winner (third won next time) all the way when beaten a neck on last month's C&D debut (12-1); likely to improve from that initial experience, so can be expected to have a major role to play.

runners.comment: Runner-up over 6f here (10-11 favourite, beaten 7l) three weeks ago; is afforded respect.
runners.name: Starryfield
runners.spotlight: 130,000euros yearling; found a single rival stronger both starts, including when returning from a 172-day absence over 6f here (10-11 favourite, beaten 7l) three weeks ago; this is marginally less competitive, so he's afforded respect now dropped to 5f.

runners.comment: Low key to date; beaten 13l (sixth of ten; 125-1) over 6f here recently; handicapping next
runners.name: Battenburg Belle
runners.spotlight: Low key to date; beaten 13l (sixth of ten; 125-1) over 6f here recently, which leaves her plenty to find to reverse placings with Starryfield; handicapping will soon be on her agenda.

runners.comment: Showed speed but failed to last when third to Yy Spirit over 6f here (20-1) six weeks ago.
runners.name: Caileag Aisling
runners.spotlight: Second foal from a 6f winner (RPR 75); showed speed but failed to last when third to Yy Spirit over 6f here (20-1) six weeks ago; this drop back to 5f is worth exploring for her second start.

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden; sixth of seven on stable debut at Southwell (6f; 50-1) a fortnight ago.
runners.name: Country Artiste
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; left Clive Cox in October for 19,000gns; weakened from outside the furlong pole when sixth of seven on stable debut at Southwell (6f; 50-1) a fortnight ago; others less exposed.

runners.comment: In need of experience when third on debut at Southwell (6f; 6-1) five weeks ago; possible.
runners.name: Egotistical
runners.spotlight: 80,000gns yearling; looked in need of the experience - bit slipped through her mouth - when third on debut at Southwell (6f; 6-1) five weeks ago; the sole runner on this card for Newmarket-based trainer Roger Varian; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Fair fourth on Southwell debut (5f; 16-1); taken a backward step at Wolverhampton since.
runners.name: Harmonised
runners.spotlight: Second foal from a 5f Listed winner (RPR 105); hinted at possessing ability herself when fourth on debut at Southwell (5f; 16-1) but she took a backward step at Wolverhampton next time; still early days in her career; headgear is retained.

runners.comment: 15-race maiden; masses of work to do with Starryfield & Battenburg Belle; tongue-tie on.
runners.name: Havin A Flyer
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden; fourth, one place in front of Harmonised, at Wolverhampton on her penultimate start but was left trailing (eighth, beaten 16l) in the 6f contest featuring Starryfield and Battenburg Belle here latest; tongue-tie now applied.

runners.comment: Possibly needed it when third over this trip at Chelmsford (11-4) 18 days ago; shortlisted
runners.name: Mad Dash
runners.spotlight: Chased home the unbeaten Desert Treasure on second start at Windsor (5f, novice) in July; possibly needed it when third over this trip at Chelmsford (11-4) 18 days ago; trainer has done well with his Newcastle runners in recent weeks; on the shortlist.

14:13.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: 0-14 but goes well here and he's high on the list now dropping into his first Class 6
runners.name: Joseph
runners.spotlight: 0-14 but he goes well here and now drops into his first Class 6 handicap; likely to be in the shake up.

runners.comment: 5 course wins, the latest last month off 2lb lower; not so good latest but may bounce back
runners.name: Tasever
runners.spotlight: Five course wins, the latest over this trip last month off 2lb lower; not so good last time but might not face much competition for the lead.

runners.comment: Hard to win with but drops into his first Class 6 and he holds each-way claims
runners.name: Sea Legend
runners.spotlight: Hard to win with but has plenty of ability; didn't find much for pressure over C&D ten days ago but this is a drop in class and he holds each-way claims.

runners.comment: 7f win here in October when rated 2lb higher; quiet more recently but drops in class
runners.name: Samra Star
runners.spotlight: 7f win here in October came off a 2lb higher mark; off the boil more recently though (too free on last two runs) and likely vulnerable despite this drop in class.

runners.comment: Runner-up in two of his three handicaps for Peter Chapple-Hyam; unexposed at a mile
runners.name: Rogue Officer
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in six runs for Peter Chapple-Hyam but he finished second in handicaps at Chelmsford (7f) in August and Yarmouth (1m, good to soft; 14 ran) in October; sold for 7,000gns shortly after the Yarmouth effort; unexposed at a mile and he's one to note for market confidence.

runners.comment: Two turf wins (1m1f, good) last August; 0-13 on AW but fully effective here
runners.name: Falcon Nine
runners.spotlight: Won twice in five days on turf last August (both 1m1f, good) and although he is 0-13 on AW, he's fully effective at this track; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Three qualifying runs not without hope and this is her first realistic assignment
runners.name: Mali And Me
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And M Dods
runners.spotlight: Three runs in novice/maiden company haven't been without hope and this is her first realistic assignment; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Chasing a six-timer and runs off the same mark as for last week's ready 7f win
runners.name: Aisling Oscar
runners.spotlight: Landed a gamble over 7f here in November, his second start for new connections, in effortless fashion and he has gone from strength to strength since, winning four more handicaps at the track (7f twice and this trip twice); unpenalised for last week's 7f success and the six-timer beckons.

runners.comment: Runner-up here on his last two starts; should remain competitive
runners.name: Little Ted
runners.spotlight: Successful at Leicester last summer and he has finished second four times since, including here on his last two runs (1m and 7f); the latest defeat was a narrow one and he should give another good account.

runners.comment: Struggled last year and new accessories aren't enough to tempt
runners.name: Chiefman
runners.spotlight: Course winner (1m2f) when trained by Archie Watson; struggled for this yard in 2025 and the addition of a tongue tie and return of cheekpieces aren't enough to tempt.

14:43.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Back on his last winning mark; running-on fourth over 5f here (9-1) 42 days ago; chance.
runners.name: Badri
runners.spotlight: Talented sprinter, winner of Epsom's JRA Tokyo Trophy in his prime in 2023; back on his last winning mark - which is 5lb lower than when eighth of 25 in the Ayr Gold Cup in September - and was a running-on fourth over 5f here (9-1) 42 days ago; every chance.

runners.breeder: Mrs M Leurson & Mrs C Head
runners.comment: Back in better shape after a break at Wolverhampton (third) latest; capable if replicating
runners.name: Coachello
runners.spotlight: Last win was 13 months ago, when produced to lead on the line at Wolverhampton (6f; from 4lb higher); was well down the field in Ayr's Silver Cup in September but back in better shape after a break at Wolverhampton (third) latest; capable if replicating.

runners.comment: Winning debut for this trainer at Southwell (6f; 40-1) in November; useful claimer booked.
runners.name: Betsen
runners.spotlight: Formerly in Ireland with Jack Davison; took advantage of an easing mark to make a winning debut for this trainer at Southwell (6f; 40-1) in November; that form received a boost when the third (Spangled Mac) went close in Bahrain recently; slight rise (2lb) and more offset via Ryan Kavanagh's claim.

runners.comment: Lost his way somewhat since finishing runner-up over C&D five weeks ago; others preferred.
runners.name: Aberama Gold
runners.spotlight: Winner of the Stewards' Cup at Goodwood in 2023; isn't the force of old but his overall AW record of 4-38 (includes five second-place finishes) is creditable; lost his way somewhat since finishing runner-up to Heavenly Heather over C&D five weeks ago; others more convincing.

runners.comment: Failed to excel in 2025; returns from absence having undergone wind surgery; best watched.
runners.name: The Bell Conductor
runners.spotlight: Wasn't beaten far in the Dash at Epsom (5f, good; sixth of 19) on Derby Day but failed to excel in three subsequent starts in 2025; returns from a 128-day absence from a fast-easing mark and having undergone wind surgery; 5-13 on AW; best watched for now.

runners.comment: C&D winner (Cl 4); less productive lately; slowly away at Southwell last weekend; visor on
runners.name: Northern Spirit
runners.owner: Steel A Win & Spring Cottage Syndicate 3
runners.spotlight: Won from a 2lb lower mark over C&D (Class 4) in August and was on the premises (fourth) in a good-quality Ascot sprint a few weeks later; less productive since, behind Aberama Gold penultimate, and slowly away post wind surgery at Southwell last weekend; a visor is now applied.

runners.comment: Fair third (beaten fav) under J. Nicholls at Lingfield a fortnight ago; needs considering.
runners.name: Silky Wilkie
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxxxi & E Burke
runners.spotlight: On a losing run which dates back to April 2023; is dangerously handicapped though, now 6lb lower than when tenth of 25 in the Ayr Silver Cup in September; fair third (beaten favourite) under Jack Nicholls at Lingfield (6f) a fortnight ago; Newcastle form figures read 24; needs considering.

15:13.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: 3-5 over C&D; carries 5lb extra for last week's C&D win; sets the sternest benchmark.
runners.name: Teardrops
runners.spotlight: Tremendous C&D record (31151), those three wins coming since introduced to blinkers (3-4); carries 5lb extra for last week's C&D win (4-1) and will likely be handicapped out of this 0-55 grade once reassessed; sets the sternest benchmark.

runners.comment: Fairly treated; has been threatening over longer trips (7f-1m) here in recent weeks.
runners.name: Ana Emaraaty
runners.spotlight: Sits 2lb below last winning mark (12.5f, Musselburgh) and has been threatening here (7f-1m) in recent weeks; was a keeping-on third to Wyvern over 7f latest so, while he has won over C&D previously, this might prove too sharp nowadays.

runners.comment: Blitzed his rivals from the front the last twice; combined rise of 8lb maybe isn't enough?
runners.name: Spartan Fighter
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: In rude health here this winter (form figures 23211); arrives seeking a third straight success after blitzing his rivals from the front the last twice; a combined rise of 8lb (4lb since beating Fircombe Hall last time) mightn't be enough to thwart his momentum; serious threat.

runners.comment: Massive prices and failed to beat a rival in two starts for this trainer; look elsewhere.
runners.name: Cordelin
runners.spotlight: Ex James Ferguson; massive prices and has failed to beat a rival in two starts (7f) for this trainer; nigh impossible to consider.

runners.comment: Few positives to take from recent AW (5f-6f) efforts; competes from an easing mark.
runners.name: Tickets
runners.spotlight: Redcar winner (6f, Class 6; good to firm) last April; few positives to take from recent AW (5f-6f) efforts, with November's C&D fifth (Teardrops third) the only real outlier in that disappointing sequence; competes from an easing mark.

runners.comment: 14-race maiden; renews C&D rivalry with the in-form Spartan Fighter on 11lb better terms.
runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.spotlight: Still seeking her first win (0-14); finished under 3l fourth to Spartan Fighter over C&D (20-1) on penultimate start and now meets that rival on 11lb better terms; lacked the pace to challenge over 5f here (fifth) since; isn't a forlorn hope.

runners.comment: Six C&D wins; played second fiddle to the front-running Spartan Fighter over C&D latest.
runners.name: Fircombe Hall
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of his last three, including when playing second fiddle to the front-running Spartan Fighter over C&D ten days ago; all six of his C&D wins have been gained from higher marks, so a 4lb turnaround with that rival gives him a squeak of revenge.

runners.comment: Keeping-on second over C&D (7-1) on New Year's Day; trainer also saddles Spartan Fighter.
runners.name: Yaahobby
runners.spotlight: No win since October 2024 but back in better form, keeping on to chase home Penny Mountain over C&D (7-1) on New Year's Day; he'll have his day again soon but his trainer has a better chance here with the hat-trick seeking Spartan Fighter.

runners.comment: Six-race maiden; shown precious little since wind surgery; a most unlikely candidate.
runners.name: Wee Nan
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; shown precious little since wind surgery, toiling over 7f here (40-1) 11 days ago; a most unlikely candidate.

15:43.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: 0-13 but he has shown enough to think he could win a similar race; now tried in tongue tie
runners.name: Instant Bond
runners.owner: David Tate Danny Lawson & Kevin Broadley
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but he has run several good races at this track; disappointed as favourite here ten days ago (behind two of these) but capable of winning a similar race and the addition of a tongue tie could help.

runners.comment: Capable at this level and a multiple C&D winner; each-way claims once again
runners.name: Asadjumeirah
runners.spotlight: Multiple C&D winner, the latest last September when just 2lb lower; generally held his form since but he finished behind Ramon Di Loria here ten days ago.

runners.comment: 0-11 but two solid C&D runs this winter; could still have a bit more to offer
runners.name: Eco Power Boy
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden but he has run encouraging races over C&D on his last two starts, latterly second of 12 in this grade 19 days ago (form boosted by the winner); could still have more to offer.

runners.comment: In front of two of these when third over C&D ten days ago; should go well once again
runners.name: Ramon Di Loria
runners.spotlight: Finished in front of Asadjumeirah and Instant Bond when third over C&D ten days ago (inconvenienced by the runner-up close home); likely to be in the thick of it once again.

runners.comment: Series of good C&D runs since October, including two wins; headgear now reached for
runners.name: Yorkshire Glory
runners.spotlight: Series of good runs over C&D since October, including back-to-back wins last month; won't need much of a boost for the addition of cheekpieces to play another leading role.

runners.comment: C&D winner but winless since October 2024; needs to up his game
runners.name: The Gay Blade
runners.spotlight: C&D success one of four wins in 2024; drawn a blank since and needs to up his game if he is to exploit his reduced mark.

runners.comment: 0-33 since joining Linda Perratt; yet to get going this winter; vulnerable once more
runners.name: Bernie The Bear
runners.spotlight: Still seeking a first win for this yard after 33 attempts; yet to get going this winter and others are much stronger.

runners.comment: Down the field in two runs back from a 292-day absence; too much to prove for comfort.
runners.name: Badosa
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two runs back from a 292-day absence (big prices); too much to prove for comfort.

16:13.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Justified favouritism off this mark over C&D in October; slow starts problematic lately.
runners.name: Dark Kestrel
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism off this mark over C&D in October but his fortunes have taken a sharp dip in more recent times, with slow starts hindering the cause; possibilities if back on song but it's difficult to know exactly what to expect.

runners.comment: Runner-up on last two starts, pushing Our Absent Friends hard (Bibendum third) latest.
runners.name: Ganesha
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins over C&D; runner-up here on last two starts, pushing Our Absent Friends hard (Bibendum third, and Harb fourth) latest; a 2lb rise (3lb better off with the winner) will make life tougher; likely to give his running; key player.

runners.comment: Slipped back to his last winning mark but might lack the pace to be positively involved.
runners.name: Darlo Pride
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And M Dods
runners.spotlight: Slipped back to his last winning mark, that gained at Wolverhampton (5f, Class 5) in December 2024; fourth, not too far behind the principals (with Ganesha second) over C&D on penultimate start; might lack the pace to be positively involved.

runners.comment: Made all, accounting for Ganesha, Bibendum, and others over C&D five weeks ago; 5lb higher
runners.name: Our Absent Friends
runners.spotlight: Made all, accounting for Ganesha (second), Bibendum (third), and a few others over C&D five weeks ago; a 5lb rise will mean that he needs to raise his game to confirm that superiority but that can't be ruled out from what is still below his peak winning mark from 2024.

runners.comment: Closest when keeping-on second to Tiriac (Our Absent Friends fourth) over C&D in November.
runners.name: Dandy Dinmont
runners.spotlight: Regularly thereabouts this winter, going closest when a keeping-on second to Tiriac (Our Absent Friends fourth) over C&D in November; cheekpieces are yet to have the desired effect as he seeks his first AW win since October 2022.

runners.breeder: Boyce Bloodstock & Mrs C E Percival
runners.comment: Fourth to Our Absent Friends (Ganesha/Bibendum involved) over C&D latest; on winning mark.
runners.name: Harb
runners.spotlight: Made a winning start for this trainer at Ayr (5f, good; same mark) in August and, by and large, hasn't done a whole lot wrong from higher marks since; no real reason why he shouldn't give Our Absent Friends, Ganesha, and Bibendum something more to think about today.

runners.comment: Disadvantaged by wide draw at Wolverhampton latest; this is potentially asking too much.
runners.name: Bibendum
runners.spotlight: Ran on well when justifying favouritism over C&D (Class 6; from 5lb lower) in November; third to Our Absent Friends next time, before being disadvantaged by a wide draw at Wolverhampton (6f) latest; this is potentially asking a bit too much.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Saint-Vincent & E A R
runners.comment: Kept on from behind to finish fifth at Southwell (5f; 33-1) recently; on a career-low mark
runners.name: Mersea
runners.spotlight: Backwards since winning at Musselburgh (5f, Class 6, good) in August; kept on from behind to finish fifth of ten at Southwell (5f; 33-1) a fortnight ago; the handicapper continues to give her assistance from a career-low mark.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P & J Hopper Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Beat Bibendum by a nose over C&D in Oct; progress has slowed (from marks in 60s) since.
runners.name: Thunderstorm Katie
runners.spotlight: Notched narrow back-to-back wins in October, inching out Bibendum over C&D latterly; progress has slowed (from marks in the 60s), never better than midfield behind Our Absent Friends and co five weeks ago; Shay Farmer's 7lb claim is helpful from handicapping perspective.

runners.comment: Flying since reintroduced to cheekpieces; latest C&D second (7-4 fav) confirmed wellbeing
runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr
runners.spotlight: Flying since reintroduced to cheekpieces over C&D last month, making all to beat Little Mi Mi (from 4lb lower) before finishing second-best to that same rival next time; latest second (7-4 favourite) confirmed continued wellbeing; likely to be in there pitching for success again.

runners.comment: Won 6f classified contest here in March; in rear throughout (last of 12) on recent return.
runners.name: Doon The Glen
runners.spotlight: Made it 25th-time lucky in a 6f classified contest here (won by a nose) in March; in rear throughout (last of 12) when returning from a 287-day absence here on New Year's Day; trainer has a better chance with Thunderstorm Katie.

13:32.race_name: Next Meeting @leicesterraces Wednesday 28th January Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Small-field winner here (1m7f) in November; can improve again over this longer trip
runners.name: Hot To Go
runners.spotlight: Irish point runner-up; flopped when warm favourite for rules debut in October but made amends with small-field win here (1m7f, soft) in November; the value of that form is open to question but he has plenty of scope for further progress over this longer trip.

runners.comment: Didn't jump well enough on last month's chase debut but won a novice hurdle in November
runners.name: Skuna Bay
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at fourth attempt over hurdles, making all for clear win in Bangor novice (2m7f, soft) in November; lacked fluency and was disappointing on last month's chase/handicap debut but has a big role to play on this quick return to hurdling.

runners.comment: Impressed on bumper debut last March and has quickly developed into a useful hurdler
runners.name: Starzand
runners.spotlight: Impressed in good-ground Ffos Las bumper on rules debut last March and justified favouritism in 2m4f maiden hurdle there (soft) in October; not discredited when clear second to another useful one there (2m, soft) recently and this move back up in trip should suit; leading contender.

runners.comment: Good staying performance when winning soft-ground C&D maiden by 16l last month
runners.name: Ubatuba
runners.spotlight: Joined Olly Murphy after slow-ground Irish point win last March and stayed on resolutely to win soft-ground C&D maiden by 16l on last month's rules debut; takes on stronger opposition today but still commands respect.

runners.comment: Not disgraced when last of five on hurdle debut (3m) but needs a big step forward here
runners.name: Bresiliant
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when last of five as a big-priced outsider on hurdle debut at Haydock (3m, good to soft) in December and remains very unexposed but needs to take a big step forward to trouble the principals here.

runners.comment: Has not shown enough on first three hurdling starts to suggest he can feature
runners.name: Could Be You
runners.spotlight: Placed in two Irish points last year but has not shown anything like enough on first three hurdling starts to suggest he can feature here.

runners.comment: Safely held in two points last month and has very tough assignment on rules debut
runners.name: Tombereau
runners.spotlight: Second in a point bumper a year ago but safely held in two jumping points last month and has very tough assignment on rules debut.

runners.comment: Has some ability but makes no significant appeal in this company
runners.name: Fine As Wine
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in all four Irish points in 2023 and returned from long absence with two fairly encouraging hurdle runs (2m3f/2m) towards end of last year, but makes no significant appeal in this company.

14:02.race_name: Kube - Leicester's Premier Events Venue Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qual') (GBB)

runners.breeder: Scea Pa Ouvry & Ecurie Des Vives Terres
runners.comment: Very well handicapped on old form but has quite a bit to prove in first chase since 2023
runners.name: Lac De Constance
runners.spotlight: Fell on only appearance last season and didn't fire on either hurdling start this autumn (albeit not beaten that far on latter occasion); very well handicapped on old form but has quite a bit to prove on first chasing start since spring 2023.

runners.comment: Useful hurdler; ran well off his lower chase mark on last month's seasonal debut
runners.name: Jipcot
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler who was contesting his first chase since 2023 when very respectable third on this month's seasonal debut at Ayr (2m4f, soft); could still be on a good mark over fences; one to consider.

runners.breeder: Mrs P Souverain & Mr A De Boisbrunet
runners.comment: Back in good form at Warwick last month and also has a C&D win on his CV
runners.name: Happy And Fine
runners.owner: L Cross S Cross & J Fitzpatrick
runners.spotlight: Quite lightly raced and has very mixed record over last couple of years but was back in good nick when winning at Warwick (3m, good to soft) three weeks ago, when he idled on the run-in and was probably value for more than the bare margin; subsequent 4lb rise is manageable and he also has a C&D win on his CV; respected.

runners.comment: Inconsistent this season but won in November and looked unlucky when second last time
runners.name: Taras Halls
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent this season but won in first-time blinkers at Newcastle in November and looked unlucky not to add to his tally at Haydock (also 2m4f, good to soft) three weeks ago, when a last-fence error was costly; up another 4lb for that but could have more to offer if in the right mood again.

runners.comment: Returns from long absence on good mark and with new headgear tried; might need this run
runners.name: Landen Calling
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer, absent since placed in big field at Cheltenham (3m1f, good) in October 2024; resumes on a good mark and with new headgear tried (usually blinkered) but is entitled to benefit from this outing.

runners.comment: Much-improved 9yo who is 4-5 for Gary Hanmer after last month's course win; big player
runners.name: Heeztheboy
runners.spotlight: Much-improved 9yo who scored here (2m4f, good to soft) just after Christmas and is now 4-5 for Gary Hanmer since October; another 7lb higher today but this stiffer stamina test won't faze him and it's hard to tell when his progress will level off.

runners.comment: Ended last year in very good form at Lingfield and is also very well suited by this track
runners.name: No Tackle
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner on soft ground; returned to form with clear success in refitted visor at Lingfield (2m6f, good) in November and last month's second over that C&D (good to soft) was perfectly respectable; current mark probably demands a career-best effort but he still warrants serious consideration on return to this track.

14:32.race_name: Join Racing TV Now Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Did not achieve a great deal when remote third on last month's rules debut at Carlisle
runners.name: Ayyadieh
runners.spotlight: Safely held in both Irish points last year and didn't achieve a great deal when remote third in Carlisle novice (2m1f, soft) won easily by an exciting prospect last month; improvement required.

runners.comment: Showed only minor promise when well-held fifth on bumper debut at Chepstow in November
runners.name: Francky Blue
runners.spotlight: From a good jumping family but showed only minor promise when well-held fifth on bumper debut at Chepstow (good to soft) in November.

runners.comment: Made encouraging late headway into sixth on last month's debut at Hereford
runners.name: Garavogue
runners.spotlight: 66-1 for last month's debut at Hereford (2m, good to soft; hooded) but made some encouraging late headway into fifth and is entitled to have learnt from that experience.

runners.comment: Shaped with more promise than eventual 42l defeat might suggest on hurdle debut
runners.name: Josh Central
runners.spotlight: Shaped with more promise than eventual 42l defeat might suggest on hurdle debut at Bangor (2m3f, soft; raced freely) in November and may benefit from combination of first-time hood and drop back in trip here.

runners.comment: Ran well to a point on first of two hurdle starts in November but others look stronger
runners.name: Kastellion
runners.spotlight: Ran well to a point on hurdle debut at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) in November but struggled to get competitive here (2m4f, soft) later that month; had wind op in December; drops in trip.

runners.comment: Shaped well when fifth on hurdle debut but is probably one for further down the line
runners.name: Le Fabuleux Bucks
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key bumper debut and shaped quite well when fifth over hurdles at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month but was about 16l behind Sutherland there and is probably one for a bit further down the line.

runners.comment: Caught the eye when keeping on steadily for fourth on stable/hurdle debut at Bangor
runners.name: Mister Ursus
runners.spotlight: Won twice on the Flat in Poland in 2024 and once in France last year; has a tendency to race too freely but caught the eye on stable/hurdle debut at Bangor (2m, soft; first-time hood) in November, keeping on steadily from a long way off the pace for never-dangerous fourth; can improve.

runners.comment: Did not get competitive in first four hurdle races
runners.name: Saint Polo
runners.spotlight: Did not get competitive in first four hurdle races (latest run attracted the stewards' attention); will probably be of greater interest if/when the handicapper sees fit to give him a mark.

runners.comment: Second to recent Lanzarote third A Pai De Nom over C&D on last month's rules debut
runners.name: Seaview Rock
runners.spotlight: Close third on Irish point debut in February 2024 and, following a long absence, chased home recent Lanzarote Hurdle third A Pai De Nom over C&D (soft; hooded) on last month's rules debut; obvious contender.

runners.comment: Seems to have some foibles but last month's Southwell second was a good effort
runners.name: Sutherland
runners.spotlight: Seems to have some foibles but was running well before a slow jump cost him considerable momentum on stable/hurdle debut in November, and last month's Southwell second (2m, good to soft) was another promising effort; probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: 8-46 on the Flat; went down fighting over C&D on hurdling debut just after Christmas
runners.name: Three Dons
runners.spotlight: 8-46 on the Flat; left it rather late in the day to launch his hurdling career but went down fighting over C&D (soft) just after Christmas and has a good chance if in similar form again.

runners.comment: Safely held when last of five finishers on hurdling debut at Catterick
runners.name: Annie McGrath
runners.spotlight: Ran out on point debut last March and was safely held when last of five finishers over hurdles at Catterick (2m3f, good) last month.

runners.comment: Not beaten far on first two hurdling starts but needs to improve to land a telling blow
runners.name: Celtic Queen
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of her four bumpers last season (good/soft) and wasn't beaten far on either hurdling start last month (2m, soft/good to soft) but needs to improve to land a telling blow here.

15:02.race_name: Leicester Racecourse Ideal Self-Hire Wedding Venue Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Has performed well on both outings this season and is likely to be suited by this track
runners.name: Razzle Dazzle Boy
runners.spotlight: Just 1-9 over hurdles but has performed well on both outings this season, more recently when a close second at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) last month; likely to be suited by this stiff, right-handed track (gained his win at Sandown) and the soft ground; commands respect.

runners.comment: Pulled up on both British starts; had wind op; now sports cheekpieces
runners.name: Ilot de LIsle
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle winner in France in autumn 2022 but not seen again until pulled up in two British handicap hurdles last year; had wind op in November and now sports cheekpieces; big leap of faith required to support him.

runners.comment: Made the frame over fences on both starts for new stable; back in trip for hurdle return
runners.name: Carrigmoorna Rowan
runners.spotlight: Became disappointing for Harry Fry last spring but was runner-up over fences at Huntingdon for new stable in November and didn't run badly when fourth at Haydock (also 2m4f, good to soft) last month; not sure to be suited by the drop back in trip for this hurdle return but still considered.

runners.comment: Went close on handicap debut and form of subsequent Kempton fifth looks strong
runners.name: At The Oche
runners.spotlight: Won Ffos Las maiden (2m, good) in October; went close on handicap debut at Ascot (2m3f, good) in November and form of last month's Kempton fifth (2m, good) has worked out well; big player if handling today's ground (raced only on good).

runners.comment: Won cosily at Southwell last month and is now 2-4 in handicaps; makes significant appeal
runners.name: Tigers Moon
runners.spotlight: Progressive 6yo who won cosily at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month and is now 2-4 in handicaps; 10lb higher here and not yet proven on ground slower than good to soft but still makes significant appeal.

runners.comment: C&D maiden winner last season and still unexposed but others have more pressing claims
runners.name: Morning Air
runners.owner: Lady Price C Shaw C Boylan & I Tagg
runners.spotlight: Quite useful on the Flat when trained in France and won heavy-ground C&D maiden on last season's stable/hurdle debut; found Listed fillies' race too hot on next outing and was beaten before falling heavily on latest hurdling start last March (two low-key Flat runs followed in the spring); had wind op in summer and remains unexposed but others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Ran okay in a novice on British debut but needs a much bigger performance in this handicap
runners.name: Best Women
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles in France but was a dual Flat and dual chase winner there; returned from long absence with fairly respectable third behind 1-25 favourite in Uttoxeter novice (2m, soft) in November but needs a much bigger performance to overcome current handicap mark.

runners.comment: Ran well over C&D in November, after a break, but two lesser efforts have followed
runners.name: Snapius
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with pretty good third over C&D (soft) in November and is now 4lb below that mark but two lesser efforts have followed and there are more appealing options in this race.

runners.comment: Placed in two good-ground juvenile hurdles; ground a worry on this handicap debut
runners.name: Zarakerjack
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who was placed in two good-ground juvenile hurdles towards the end of last year, despite showing a tendency to jump left; could have improvement to come in handicap hurdles but was withdrawn from a race with soft ground deemed unsuitable last month and conditions are a worry here.

runners.comment: 0-6 over hurdles and absent since third in mares' novice at Catterick in December 2022
runners.name: Comedaygoday
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles and absent since third in mares' novice at Catterick (1m7f, soft) in December 2022; given a chance by the handicapper in the meantime but it's wise to wait for some encouraging signals from the betting.

runners.comment: Well beaten over hurdles on stable debut and pulled up in two subsequent chases
runners.name: Bossofthebus
runners.spotlight: Won Clonmel handicap (2m4f, soft) a year ago; well beaten over hurdles on seasonal/stable debut in October and pulled up in two subsequent chaes; may yet come good for Evan Williams but has a lot more to prove than some of these; tongue-tie added.

15:32.race_name: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Off since late 2024 but well treated on form for Alan King and market can guide
runners.name: Hall Lane
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner on good to soft, chase win on good; off since December 2024 but he's well treated on best form at about this trip for Alan King and has gone well fresh; market check needed but reappears at a realistic level.

runners.comment: Three good maiden hurdle runs but he finished remote in first completion over fences
runners.name: Devon Dude
runners.spotlight: Three good runs in maiden hurdles at up to 2m4f last spring but he's fallen, been pulled up and finished remote in three chase runs this winter; big turnaround needed for the step up in trip.

runners.comment: Won 2m2f French chase; long absence but promising over 2m latest; much stiffer test here
runners.name: Jeu dOpale
runners.spotlight: Won 2m2f chase in France in 2022 but missed 2023 and 2024; best effort yet for this yard when the only one to give a subsequent winner a race on the return to fences at Lingfield (2m, good to soft) last month; now has to prove suited by this much stiffer test; yard won this last year.

runners.comment: Front-runs; beaten when fell heavily 3 out latest; stiff track is a query
runners.name: Another Day Out
runners.spotlight: Three front-running chase wins, including at 3m (good to soft); two good efforts in the autumn but her race was run when she took a heavy fall three out at Wincanton recently; has more to prove after that, especially as her best form has come on sharp tracks.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Domaine De Baune Francois Thomas
runners.comment: Maiden; moving in the right direction over fences but has stiffest stamina test to date
runners.name: Le Galli Bier
runners.spotlight: Not yet off the mark but he ran a fair race at Fontwell (about 2m3f, heavy) in December, against one who was well ahead of his mark, and looks to be moving in the right direction; has a stiffer stamina test today, though, and needs to improve for it.

runners.comment: C&D winner; just above latest winning mark; below best latest; needs revival
runners.name: Mixedwave
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who has won on a range of surfaces; only just above his latest winning mark but he was some way below form at Huntingdon (where he has a good record) last month so has a slight question mark here.

runners.comment: In good form over hurdles; unseated back chasing latest but has possibilities
runners.name: Streamsforth Lad
runners.spotlight: Wasn't persevered with over fences after pulling up on chase debut last February but in good form over hurdles (2m4f and 3m) for this yard and, although he unseated at the eighth fence back chasing at Uttoxeter recently, he'd jumped soundly up to then; has possibilities.

runners.comment: Maiden who should be competitive on best form at about this trip, including for new yard
runners.name: Kapamazov
runners.spotlight: Not yet off the mark but he ran some fair races for previous yard and lost out only late at Huntingdon (2m7f, good; has form on soft) last March; two respectable efforts for new trainer of late and can be competitive.

runners.comment: Won two 2m4f chases last midwinter; pulled up in 2 of last 3 starts; not too compelling
runners.name: River Run Free
runners.spotlight: Won first two chases after tongue-tie was fitted, both over 2m4f (heavy and soft) last midwinter, one on this track; pulled up in two of his last three starts though, a long way out at Exeter (cheekpieces added and retained) in December; not too compelling.

runners.comment: Well held latest but an excellent record here, two wins and five places from seven runs
runners.name: Nine Nine Nine
runners.spotlight: Both wins on this track in 2024 and has been placed in his other five course runs; never involved at Uttoxeter recently but he was a close second over C&D previously and a modest run back here would be something new.

16:02.race_name: Watch On Racing TV 'Hands & Heels' Mares' Handicap Hurdle (CJs' & Amateur Riders') (Part Of The REI)

runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles but drops in grade after fairly encouraging seasonal debut last month
runners.name: Kantagua Du Large
runners.spotlight: French chase winner in 2024; 0-7 over hurdles but made quite encouraging seasonal debut when fifth in stronger race than this at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) last month and has possibilities if that run brought her on.

runners.comment: Battled well for narrow course win (1m7f) two runs ago but is not one to rely upon
runners.name: Sophie Power
runners.spotlight: Battled well for narrow course win (1m7f, soft) in November, her seventh hurdle run, but was safely held on her latest outing and is probably not one to rely upon heavily; ventures beyond 2m1f for first time.

runners.comment: Remote last of four on seasonal debut but might have needed that run; still unexposed
runners.name: Subtle Fortune
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner who opened rules account in Uttoxeter novice (2m6f, soft) at end of 2024; remote last of four when returning from long layoff in heavy-ground handicap over that C&D last month but that run certainly wasn't devoid of positives and she might last longer here.

runners.comment: Looked out of sorts when pulled up on both starts this season; now tries blinkers
runners.name: Walkinthecotswolds
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than when making all at Chepstow (2m3f, heavy) just under a year ago but looked out of sorts when pulled up on first two starts this season (latterly over C&D) and needs a huge boost from the new blinkers; usual tongue-tie left off.

runners.comment: Dropped out very tamely on last month's seasonal/stable debut; needs to turn a corner
runners.name: Chosen Hero
runners.spotlight: Left Archie Watson after string of disappointing runs last season and dropped out very tamely on last month's stable debut at Carlisle (2m1f, soft); needs to turn a corner.

runners.comment: Only minor promise in her qualifying runs but improvement likely in handicaps
runners.name: Pearl Smoke
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than minor promise in three maiden/novice hurdles last year (2m-2m3f) but should have some improvement to come in handicaps and her pedigree suggests the increased emphasis on stamina here will suit.

runners.comment: 0-13 over hurdles but ran well in last 2 editions of this race; probably in the mix again
runners.name: After Many Days
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles but kept on for second at Hereford (2m3f, good) in October, after a break, and also ran well in last two editions of this race (both times on heavy); probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Off the mark with clear Kelso win in November and has posted another good effort since
runners.name: Take A Hike
runners.spotlight: Opened account with clearcut success at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) in November and ran well until stamina ebbed away at Ayr (3m, heavy) last month; drops back in trip here and has another big role to play.

runners.comment: Five wins (three on the Flat) in 2025; may yet have a bigger performance in her
runners.name: Queen Of Steel
runners.spotlight: Won two good-ground hurdles (2m4f/3m) and three consecutive Flat races during highly productive spell last spring/summer and bettered low-key reappearance run when respectable third at Uttoxeter (2m4f, soft) last month; may yet have a bigger performance in her.

runners.comment: Very unexposed mare who makes her stable/handicap debut after £15,000 sale in October
runners.name: Natus Vincere
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in spring 2024; well beaten in three maiden/novice hurdles (2m-2m4f) for Laura Morgan the following November but Olly Murphy picked her up for £15,000 in October and she has a lowly opening mark to work with; tongue-tie added; market reference recommended.

runners.comment: Out of form this season and considered only if lively in the betting
runners.name: Shesupincourt
runners.spotlight: Out of form over hurdles and fences since returning from a break in September; on a good mark and versatile regarding ground but considered only if lively in the betting.

17:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.comment: Drop in class and first-time blinkers may prompt a turnaround for this six-race maiden
runners.name: The English Rogue
runners.spotlight: Has regressed in two starts since running well on handicap debut, taking record to 0-6; however, this combination of drop in class and first-time blinkers may prompt a turnaround.

runners.breeder: Mrs Susan Roy & Mr Nicolas Wrigley
runners.comment: Chance partly depends on whether he improves for fitting of tongue-tie
runners.name: Asian Journey
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in most turf starts for previous yard; hasn't fared so well in two AW races for new stable; chance partly depends on whether he improves for fitting of tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Good chance off current mark provided he rebounds in first-time headgear
runners.name: Outrun The Storm
runners.spotlight: Record of 5-37 on turf and  2-15 on AW; folded tamely returned to this sphere last time but has a good chance off current mark provided he rebounds in first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Far from solid on his form since returned to AW
runners.name: Zu Run
runners.spotlight: Registered AW wins in 2022 and 2024 but looks far from solid on his form since returned to this sphere; probably best watched unless the market speaks favourably.

runners.comment: Record of 1363 since wearing cheekpieces; ran creditably at Southwell last time
runners.name: No Knee Never
runners.spotlight: Record of 1363, mostly over 6f, since wearing cheekpieces (maiden previously); ran creditably at Southwell most recently; likely player, provided he's as effective back at 7f.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D in November; not disgraced back here last time; remains of interest
runners.name: Onemorenomore
runners.spotlight: Opened his AW account in C&D event in November; switch to front-running didn't quite pay dividends here last time but he still ran respectably; remains of interest in this scenario.

runners.comment: Remains attractively treated, having gained both wins off current mark
runners.name: Rainwater
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly over further but ran respectably in last 7f attempt; placed at Chelmsford (1m) most recently; remains attractively treated, having gained both wins off current mark.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but went close in first-time blinkers over C&D most recently
runners.name: Overlooked
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but he's in a consistent vein of form and went down by only half a length in first-time blinkers over C&D most recently; in the mix, with the blinds retained.

runners.comment: Weak claims on his form for new yard; 6f seems his ideal trip
runners.name: Prince Of Bel Lir
runners.spotlight: Holds weak claims on his form this winter for new yard; possibly found 5f too sharp last time but returning to 7f may not be the answer; 6f has looked his optimum trip.

runners.comment: Hasn't won a handicap since 2022; needs to improve on this year's classified form
runners.name: Headshot
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won a handicap since 2022 and needs to improve on this year's classified efforts, latest over C&D; went close in last handicap attempt but that was only a 0-55 event.

runners.comment: Still a maiden and isn't particularly solid on this winter's efforts
runners.name: Dequinto
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden at the age of seven and isn't particularly solid on his two efforts since returning from lengthy layoff; others preferred.

runners.comment: Inconsistent maiden; opposed
runners.name: Shoptilyoudrop
runners.owner: James And Susan Cookson And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: Remains an inconsistent maiden and it's still a long time since her sole piece of placed form; opposed.

17:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Has form figures of 116 over C&D; may still have more to offer in this scenario
runners.name: Ararat
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 116 over C&D, all attempts in the autumn; down the field over 7f at Chelmsford since but may still have more to offer in this scenario; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Couple of sound performances for new yard, fourth dropped to 6f at Southwell latest
runners.name: Gunlock
runners.spotlight: Couple of sound performances this winter for new yard, winning over 7f at Kempton then close fourth dropped to 6f at Southwell; remains unexposed at this trip; enters calculations.

runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & Tally Ho Stud
runners.comment: Successful in July/September in last two attempts over C&D; difficult to dismiss
runners.name: Hierarchy
runners.spotlight: Race didn't pan out favourably last time when bidding to follow up his Kempton win; successful in July/September in last two attempts over C&D; difficult to dismiss.

runners.comment: Took well to first-time cheekpieces in C&D event most recently; may improve further
runners.name: Hunky Dory
runners.spotlight: Record of 3221 for new stable, most recently taking well to first-time cheekpieces in C&D event; may build on that account-opening win and improve further; respected in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Remains well treated on best turf form; possibilities dropped back to 6f
runners.name: Sergeant Pep
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly at Lingfield (6f) on belated return to AW and the step up to 7f provides an excuse for subsequent effort; remains well treated on best turf form; possibilities.

runners.comment: Absent since finishing fifth over C&D two months ago; 0-10 for current stable
runners.name: Bosh
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing fifth over C&D two months ago; 0-10 for current stable but remains well handicapped on historical data; admittedly doesn't seem the force of old.

runners.comment: Failed to score last year; finished behind Gunlock over C&D on reappearance
runners.name: Amazonian Dream
runners.spotlight: Failed to score last year, despite dropping in the weights, and finished behind Gunlock over C&D on reappearance; however, may fare better with that outing under his belt.

runners.comment: Has done his winning over 7f; not the percentage call returned to 6f
runners.name: Beattie Is Back
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Has done his winning over 7f and doesn't look the percentage call returned to 6f on reappearance; absent since June defeat when bidding for a Doncaster double.

runners.comment: Largely consistent of late; each-way possibilities back down in grade
runners.name: Papa Cocktail
runners.spotlight: Generally consistent form (turf/AW) since last July features two wins; came up short in Class 3 last most recently but has each-way possibilities back down in grade.

runners.comment: Has shown peak form over 5f; doesn't seem to be crying out for return to 6f
runners.name: Hundred Caps
runners.spotlight: Has shown peak form over 5f, including win on turf and second on AW in last two appearances; may do better still but doesn't appear to be crying out for this return to 6f.

18:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Muhaarar gelding; dam sprint maiden; best watched on belated debut
runners.name: Sweetstevie
runners.spotlight: Muhaarar gelding; dam sprint maiden (RPR 55), half-sister to two winning sprinters; likely best watched on belated debut.

runners.comment: Never-dangerous sixth of nine in C&D maiden three months ago
runners.name: Kurios Lady
runners.spotlight: Never-dangerous sixth of nine in C&D maiden three months ago but may do better with the experience under her belt.

runners.comment: Beat only one rival in 7f event at Wolverhampton
runners.name: Baggie Boy
runners.spotlight: Dropped away and beat only one rival in 7f event at Wolverhampton; needs a big step forward.

runners.comment: Fared better upped to 1m at Lingfield and may take another step forward
runners.name: Silver State
runners.spotlight: Seemed to find 6f too sharp last spring on debut (subsequently gelded); duly fared better upped to 1m at Lingfied last month, keeping-on third in small field; may take another step forward.

runners.comment: Close second when favourite at Newcastle last time; should do better still
runners.name: Itica
runners.spotlight: From a family that his served his stable well; close second when favourite at Newcastle (1m) last time, duly stepping up plenty on his debut effort; should be capable of better still; major contender.

runners.comment: May settle better and improve on his Brighton effort with hood now fitted
runners.name: Rajendra
runners.spotlight: Faded into sixth of seven, having taken a good hold, at Brighton (7f) four months ago; gelded since; may settle better and show improvement with hood now fitted; related to a few winners for his connections.

runners.comment: Meagre RPRs in two races over 7f
runners.name: Big Moonrise
runners.spotlight: Meagre RPRs in two races over 7f; sibling to two winners for his connections but likely to be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

runners.comment: Bred to do better still, being a sibling to two winners for his connections
runners.name: Rawson
runners.spotlight: Modest third at Southwell (7f) then never landed a blow at Chelmsford (6f) but he's bred to do better still, being a sibling to two winners for his connections; step back up in trip looks a plus.

runners.comment: Never-dangerous sixth of nine in 1m maiden at Lingfield
runners.name: Si White
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Xxx & Chris Rees
runners.spotlight: Never-dangerous sixth of nine, having been slowly away, in 1m maiden at Lingfield; this Prescott runner may not flourish until handicapping.

runners.comment: Finished nicely for eyecatching fifth at Lingfield; interesting contender
runners.name: Poor Relation
runners.spotlight: Finished nicely for eyecatching fifth of 11, amid greenness, in 1m contest at Lingfield; may improve sharply with the experience under her belt; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Clear second at Newmarket in sole 2yo start; winner has franked the form since
runners.name: Si Grass
runners.spotlight: Siblings include a Listed scorer for her yard; duly showed promise with clear second of five, running on, at the Newmarket July course (7f) in sole 2yo start; winner has franked the form since; respected.

runners.comment: Modest fourth of seven in 7f maiden at Southwell
runners.name: Star Suepreme
runners.spotlight: Modest fourth of seven, beaten 12l, in 7f maiden at Southwell; plenty to find with the main contenders on bare figures.

runners.comment: Well treated on past AW form and lost out very late on to Pride Eye over C&D latest
runners.name: The Spotlight Kid
runners.spotlight: Both AW wins on Polytrack but acts on Tapeta and nearly pulled off a course debut win here recently when denied very late on by Pride Eye; back up 1lb but still well treated and can give it another good shot.

runners.comment: Four defeats in Newcastle handicaps but late headway over 7f latest and worth a go at 1m
runners.name: Pebble Dash
runners.spotlight: Four defeats in Newcastle handicaps at 6f and 7f but he made a promising move into fifth from off the pace last month and the extra furlong looks worth investigating; may yet improve.

runners.comment: Well treated but out of sorts, including at Newcastle latest (dual winner there)
runners.name: Ratafia
runners.spotlight: Turf winner at 1m last June but under the parapet thereafter and he never reached a challenging position at Newcastle last month (dual winner there); temptingly treated but risky.

runners.comment: Improved form when C&D winner latest (66-1); can go on from that off 2lb higher
runners.name: Pride Eye
runners.spotlight: Just minor promise when qualifying; well held on handicap debut at Newcastle but she's bred to be better than that and a strong late run took her to the front over C&D latest (66-1; tongue-tie refitted), nailing The Spotlight Kid and a subsequent winner; just 2lb higher; can improve.

runners.comment: Down weights and back to form over 7f here latest; has won at 1m on turf; can play a part
runners.name: Roaring Ralph
runners.spotlight: Had been out of sorts but he was close to taking advantage of a weights drop back here (7f; has won over that C&D) recently; rarely seen over this far but he did win a 1m turf handicap as a 4yo; has claims.

runners.comment: Sole win in 2023; unraced here but running well on Tapeta elsewhere; thereabouts again
runners.name: Hows The Guvnor
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back to sole win, in July 2023, and he has no course experience, but he's been running well on Tapeta elsewhere (7f and 1m) and should find a race off his reduced mark; thereabouts.

runners.comment: Nearly off the mark here (7f) last March; well held for new yard after layoff; trip query
runners.name: War Memorial
runners.spotlight: Came very close to a first win over 7f here last March but soundly beaten in two runs for new yard following a layoff and the return to 1m from widest draw raises more doubts.

runners.comment: Sole win at 1m3f on turf; acts well on Tapeta but having first 1m run since 2023
runners.name: Whatacracker
runners.spotlight: Acts on this surface but his sole win came over 1m3f at Carlisle in 2023 and mostly campaigned at that trip and further since; major query back at 1m for first time in the best part of three years.

runners.comment: Improved since switched to this surface, narrow winner over C&D latest; can progress again
runners.name: Timely Affair
runners.spotlight: Minor turf form when qualifying but dam was best on AW and sole sibling was 2-4 on sand so no surprise he's achieved more on this surface, following a narrow C&D defeat by coming out on top in a classified event here (from a subsequent winner) since; can progress further.

runners.comment: In fine form over 7f since November, winning here last month; bit to prove over new trip
runners.name: Cable Beach
runners.spotlight: In a good vein of form over 7f since November, winning here last month and close up at Newcastle since; this trip is new territory though and will need more for it against rivals who are proven over 1m.

runners.comment: Big prices and not yet involved in four starts, latest on handicap debut over 6f in July
runners.name: Emperors Logic
runners.spotlight: Big prices and not yet involved in just four starts, most recently on handicap debut over 6f on turf last July; lots to find back over 1m.

runners.comment: Two AW wins last winter (6f/7f); capable of better form than shown of late; mixed at 1m
runners.name: Evoluir
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins last winter, over 6f here and 7f at Wolverhampton; hinted that he might stay 1m at Newcastle last March but lesser efforts in subsequent attempts at the trip and slow to find form since back from break.

19:00.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Ahead of his mark after a good second at Newcastle last week; low mileage & obvious claims
runners.name: Dollars Dream
runners.spotlight: Comfortably his best effort so far when second of eight in a 2m handicap at Newcastle last week; pulled a long way clear of the third and is ahead of the handicapper; high on the list with Rossa Ryan booked.

runners.comment: On a losing run and 0-16 on AW; well backed latest but disappointed; can't discount
runners.name: Haliphon
runners.spotlight: On losing run and 0-16 on AW, unable to justify favouritism at Chelmsford 12 days ago; another 2lb lower today and too much ability to discount.

runners.comment: Better than this in her youth; no surprise were James Owen to coax her back to form
runners.name: Shibuya Song
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m4f Flat handicap for Ed Walker in July 2022; low-grade hurdler for Richard Phillips more recently; no surprise were new stable to find the key to her and the betting should be revealing.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and penultimate run was encouraging; seriously considered in this field
runners.name: Smokey Malone
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner, including C&D, and now 1lb lower than for his Chelmsford success last April; promising effort at Chelmsford on penultimate start and then stumbled and unseated his rider early 12 days ago; one to take seriously in this field.

runners.comment: 1m4f turf win off this mark for former yard; minor hurdle form for new yard; not ruled out
runners.name: Innisfree Pearl
runners.spotlight: 1m4f turf win off this mark when trained by Tom Ward; only minor promise in two hurdle runs for new yard but she returns to the Flat in a weak race; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a 1m3f classified event here two weeks ago; no appeal
runners.name: Destination Unkown
runners.spotlight: Tailed off over 1m3f here two weeks ago in a classified event (150-1); makes no appeal.

runners.comment: 24-race maiden; the odd good run in late 2025 but others look stronger
runners.name: Yurinov
runners.spotlight: 24-race maiden; the odd good effort in the latter part of 2025 but others are more appealing for win purposes.

runners.comment: First Flat run since April 2023; likely best watched on yard debut after eight months off
runners.name: Socks Off
runners.spotlight: AW bumper/minor hurdle winner; in fair form over hurdles last spring but makes his stable debut after eight months off and his last Flat run was back in April 2023.

runners.comment: Poor form over shorter, including handicap debut; no appeal
runners.name: Manny Oh
runners.spotlight: Poor form in four starts, including his handicap debut (11.5f, good) when last seen in September; new trip not enough to tempt.

19:30.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandad's Bookie Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Arrives with plenty to prove but is down in grade and Billy Loughnane has been booked
runners.name: Achnamara
runners.spotlight: Out of sorts on Flat and over hurdles since May, the latest when a well-beaten 100-1 shot here (2m) 17 days ago; drops in grade with Billy Loughnane booked but he's not a solid option.

runners.comment: Stayed on well to win at Lingfield on Saturday (2m); penalised but is at least in top form
runners.name: Forglen
runners.spotlight: 1m6f win at Wolverhampton last summer; back to winning ways when leading late at Lingfield on Saturday (2m); 5lb penalty demands more but this is not a strong contest.

runners.comment: On the downgrade and latest third, when beaten over 7l, needs bettering
runners.name: Hedonista
runners.spotlight: She has dropped a long way in the weights since joining this yard and hasn't made a major impact; latest Chelmsford third (beaten over 7l) was a bit better but she will need to step forward again to take this.

runners.breeder: S Clarke G Parsons & A Wideson
runners.comment: Failed to win in 2025 but often ran well; new trip; chance in an uncompetitive race
runners.name: Stintino Sunset
runners.spotlight: Several placed efforts on turf in 2025 and she was third of 11, albeit beaten 8.75l, in a classified event here two weeks ago (1m3f); steps up in trip; cheekpieces the headgear of choice today.

runners.comment: Poor form on Flat and over hurdles thus far; not easily recommended
runners.name: Flame Dancer
runners.spotlight: Poor Flat form for David Loughnane; little to shout about in two hurdle runs for current stable, the latest nine days ago; enough to prove.

runners.comment: Struggled in 2025 and he is hard to recommend with any confidence
runners.name: Abstract
runners.spotlight: Had a long absence before reappearing last January and he didn't offer a great deal of encouragement in 2025.

runners.comment: 19th-time lucky at Newcastle in November (12.5f); not so good at Wolverhampton latest
runners.name: Himself
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 19th attempt when winning a 12.5f handicap at Newcastle in November; not so good over this trip at Wolverhampton 24 days ago; others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.comment: Unplaced all ten starts; too much to prove for comfort
runners.name: West Wickham
runners.owner: New Vision Bloodstock & Steel A Win
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all ten starts, most recently a well-beaten ninth of ten in a 1m3f classified event here; hard to recommend.

runners.comment: Respectable fourth in Class 4 events the last twice; possibilities back down in grade
runners.name: Jodhpur Blue
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-14 but he's in form, having posted respectable fourth-place finishes in Class 4 events over 1m2f the last twice; possibilities back down in grade.

runners.comment: Disappointing here last time but a rebound would put this seven-time AW winner in the mix
runners.name: Its A Love Thing
runners.spotlight: Back in better form in October/November; disappointing favourite at Southwell (1m4f) last month but a rebound would put this seven-time AW winner in the picture.

runners.breeder: S C E A Du Haras Des Sablonnets Et Al
runners.comment: 0-15 in handicaps but has frame possibilities on most of his form for current yard
runners.name: Brodies Boy
runners.spotlight: Gained sole success in maiden; 0-15 in handicaps but has frame possibilities on most of his form for current yard, including respectable third over C&D last time.

runners.comment: Defied a 4lb higher mark over C&D last April; only midfield here latest start
runners.name: Bearwith
runners.spotlight: Mixed results since returned to AW, only midfield here most recently; however, defied a 4lb higher mark over C&D last April and has a good chance if back to that form.

runners.comment: Comes with risk but is well treated assuming he proves suited by this new trip
runners.name: Boubyan
runners.spotlight: Has recorded best two performances at about 1m; 0-7 and inconsistent for current yard; comes with risk but is well treated assuming he proves suited by the new trip.

runners.comment: Best effort in sole attempt in cheekpieces, which are now reapplied; stable debut
runners.name: Karthala
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden for Roger Varian; sold for 15,000gns since last run; posted best effort in sole attempt in cheekpieces, which are now reapplied; market may offer further guidance.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo; has taken well to this C&D and looks open to further progress; respected
runners.name: Dust Cover
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who has taken well to this C&D, winning in November then going down by only a whisker last month; the form has substance and he's open to further progress; respected.

20:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Losing sequence is mounting up but this drop in class may do the trick
runners.name: Catch Cunningham
runners.spotlight: Possibly needed latest run (when back from a break); losing sequence is mounting up but this drop in class may do the trick; interesting at this level off 11lb below last winning mark.

runners.comment: May be capable of improvement now handicapping
runners.name: Special Acclaim
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced gelding who has shown signs of ability in sprints and may be capable of improvement now handicapping; market support would heighten interest.

runners.comment: Took well to first-time blinkers at Newcastle last week; respected in the retained blinds
runners.name: Azucena
runners.spotlight: Took well to first-time blinkers at Newcastle (5f) last week on first outing under the care of Stephen Hanlon; respected in the retained blinds, despite incurring a 5lb penalty for a neck win.

runners.comment: Consistent at Wolverhampton since November; four-time C&D winner; solid
runners.name: Street Life
runners.spotlight: Consistent form at Wolverhampton since November comprises one win and five efforts in the frame; four-time scorer over this C&D; solid claims, despite his advancing years.

runners.comment: Not the force of fold but managed to regain the winning thread at Chelmsford last time
runners.name: Shalaa Asker
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old but managed to regain the winning thread at Chelmsford (5f) most recently, ending a long losing run; back up only 3lb and may remain competitive.

runners.comment: 0-4 for current stable but went very close over C&D most recently; possibilities
runners.name: Stash The Cash
runners.owner: D Morgan And K J Parris
runners.spotlight: Three turf wins for previous yard; 0-4 for current stable but went very close in visor over C&D most recently; possibilities, provided he's in similar form with the headgear removed.

runners.comment: Down the field in C&D event when last seen; debut for new yard
runners.name: Fortunate Star
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner for Declan Carroll but down the field in C&D event when last seen; sold for £3,000 since; wears new headgear; market may prove best guide.

runners.comment: Gained sole win over C&D; had a possible excuse back here last time
runners.name: Juno Star
runners.owner: The Ten Fools & A Horse Partnership
runners.spotlight: Gained sole win over C&D; below-par favourite back here last time but the race possibly came too soon after an effort two days earlier; may rebound if taking well to first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Far from consistent; yet to win on AW
runners.name: Tilsworth Turf
runners.spotlight: Produced one of his better efforts in last C&D attempt but is by no means sure to reproduce it, being far from consistent; yet to win on AW.
